credit_opinion.summary: Ardagh is in ACTIVE RESTRUCTURING with distress score of 52 - among highest in portfolio. Chapter 15 filed for ARD Finance holdco. Houlihan Lokey engaged. CDS deliverables being litigated (Arini vs Tresidor/Laurion) creating additional complexity. Net leverage 9.0x with NEGATIVE equity (-$3.4bn) indicates balance sheet insolvency. Senior Secured bonds at 95-102 suggest near-full recovery, but Senior Unsecured at 94-95 facing haircut. Complex multi-entity structure (Ardagh Group, ARD Finance, AMP) creates significant intercompany and structural subordination risk. This is a WORKOUT situation - not a performing credit.

lme_warning_flags: Chapter 15 FILED for ARD Finance SA

cds_considerations.reference_entity: ARD Finance SA / Ardagh Group SA
cds_considerations.deliverables_issue: ACTIVE LITIGATION - Arini vs Tresidor over SUN deliverability
cds_considerations.note: Landmark CDS deliverables dispute. Outcome affects future restructuring CDS settlements.

arini_position.argument: SUNs should be EXCLUDED from deliverables
arini_position.rationale: Outstanding principal balance (OPB) was already ZERO when restructuring credit event triggered
arini_position.theory: TSA and consent solicitation bound SUNs to equitization before credit event determination

tresidor_position.argument: SUNs should be INCLUDED in deliverables
tresidor_position.rationale: Article IV (credit events) and Article III (deliverables/OPB) are SEPARATE in ISDA architecture
tresidor_position.accusations: Arini contains 'logical non-sequiturs', 'quotes selectively', makes 'dangerous attempt to collapse distinct parts of CDS architecture'

key_isda_distinction.article_iv: Governs CREDIT EVENTS - timing of when event occurred
key_isda_distinction.article_iii: Governs DELIVERABLE OBLIGATIONS and Outstanding Principal Balance (OPB)
key_isda_distinction.tresidor_argument: External review panel only ruled on WHEN credit event occurred (Article IV), NOT whether SUNs have OPB for settlement (Article III)

schrodingers_obligation_paradox.description: Can SUNs be both bound to equitization for credit-event purposes AND still outstanding for settlement?
schrodingers_obligation_paradox.tresidor_view: Yes - Article IV and III serve different functions, asymmetry is a feature not a bug

cac_argument.arini_position: CACs meant SUNs already subject to binding principal reduction
cac_argument.tresidor_rebuttal: CACs are 'amendment machinery, not self-executing principal-reducing provisions' - TSA and consent solicitation drove restructuring, not CAC terms alone

permitted_contingency_defense.rule: Reductions in OPB from actions 'within control of holders' are EXCLUDED from calculation
permitted_contingency_defense.application: SUN holders led, negotiated, and agreed the restructuring - principal changes from collective voting should be ignored

cds_litigation_detail.counterfactual_argument: If Ardagh entered insolvency before supplemental indenture executed, TSA would have terminated and SUNs would remain valid claims at full face value - proves principal not yet reduced

settlement_mechanics.tresidor_position: Delivering post-reorganization instruments is allowed and necessary for representative auction
settlement_mechanics.warning: Denying delivery flexibility would create artificial distinctions between bankruptcy and restructuring credit events

market_implications.if_arini_wins: CDS protection buyers lose - SUNs excluded, auction recovery artificially high
market_implications.if_tresidor_wins: CDS protection buyers win - SUNs deliverable, auction reflects true restructuring impairment
market_implications.precedent_impact: Outcome will define how Article III vs Article IV interact in future restructurings

lme_risk_proxy.case_study_relevance: ARDAGH IS A LANDMARK CDS CASE STUDY demonstrating: (1) holdco structural subordination risk, (2) CDS deliverables disputes between Article III and IV, (3) Schr√∂dinger's obligation paradox, (4) permitted contingency defenses, (5) creditor-on-creditor warfare. This case will set precedent for future restructuring CDS settlements.
